subject: Productivity
title: BF Skinner and Reinforcement
description: A short lesson to help you apply BF Skinner and Reinforcement.

hook.text: BF Skinner put pigeons in a box with a lever. Press the lever, get food. Habit formed in minutes.

buildup.text: Operant conditioning showed that consequences shape future behavior. Reward it, and it repeats.

discovery.text: Skinner found that intermittent rewards create the strongest habits. Unpredictability hooks the brain.

twist.text: Every notification ping on your phone uses Skinner's principle. Variable reward, maximum engagement.

climax.text: Skinner's work explains why some habits feel impossible to break. The reward schedule is the trap.

punchline.text: Unpredictable rewards are the strongest chains.

quiz.question: What type of reward schedule creates the strongest habits according to Skinner?
options: Delayed rewards given once a week
